item.title: Vehicle has been there 2 months, 14th October
item.description:
This vehicle has been parked outside my house for 2 months and hasn’t moved along with a black Volkswagen polo reg C230TT, this street is free parking one of a few remaining, I sometimes receive parking tickets cause there is nowhere to park outside my house or near it due to people taking advantage of bramhope and Tallis groves free parking. Where as surrounding roads I.E Victoria way, wellington gardens, wyncliff road ect are all permitted

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tallis Grove, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bikes overcrowded around 55 baker street building Blandford street/baker street/dorset street, 14th October
item.description:
Lime and human forest bikes blocking pavement and cycle stand also on dorset street blocking car parking bays overcrowded around 55 baker street building Blandford street/dorset street/baker street need to clear out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Baker Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeated dog poo on Pinnacle Hill, 14th October
item.description:
On a daily basis - we are seeing an increase in dog mess / poo on the footpath at Pinnacle Hill - there are two schools nearby and this road is used by Children’s going to school and is not convenient for them - can some action be taken asap please - thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pinnacle Hill, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous and unnecessary cycle lane closure, 14th October
item.description:
Hi- this closure of a major cycle route is unnecessary and potentially dangerous. There are actually no works obstructing the lane in Wellington St. The closure of the northbound cycle filter lane on the A301 is also unnecessary, forcing cyclists into potentially dangerous interactions with buses and lorries at the junction even if turning right. Finally the diversion for cyclists is poorly signed and unsuitable, forcing them to use significantly busier roads with less separation from buses. It is also poorly signed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 351, Strand, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car seemingly abandoned outside 95 Wilton Way, 14th October
item.description:
Car has been there for approx 10 days. Passenger side door is unlocked, I've twice seen people pass by, open the door and root through it. There are no tickets on the car, so it must have a permit of some kind but it's not secured

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Penpoll Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
